page.title: 07POPULATION
page.content: According to the 1981 Census there were more females than males in the district.There were 3206 females and 2933 males,therefore the overall population was 6139.On the day the census was taking place however 30 people were visiting Strathaven and 84 people were staying in Public Establishments i.e. hotels etc.The actual population was therefore 6109(2959 males and 3150 females). About two thirds of the population (4025) lived in council houses and the rest (2084) owned their homes or were members of families who did.We did a survey to see how many people worked outside Strathaven and found that 70 out of the hundred people asked worked outside Strathaven.From this we can see that Strathaven is largely a town of commuters(mainly to East Kilbride).
